coverAlt: A closeup of pink and white roses from above
title: How to Do Nothing
subTitle: Resisting the Attention Economy
author: Jenny Odell
description: Written by an artist who draws from history to understand how we can live a more purposeful life. The provocative title actually implies a balance we need to achieve and the necessity of missing out.

coverAlt: An illustration of a mouse in a red cape riding on the back of a crow
title: Mrs. Frisby and the Rats of NIMH
author: Robert C. O'Brien
description: Adding some books that I am reading to my child. This is one that I was very excited to share with her.

coverAlt: An illustration of a man dressed in a suit and 2 limurs are sitting around him
title: Creativity
subTitle: A Short and Cheerful Guide
author: John Cleese
description: Creativity is not a skill or a talent… it is simply an ability to play and get into a mindset where we trust our own ideas and instincts. Note to self: also read the audiobook because the author reads it.

coverAlt: Large blog letters that say you got this with a cat running around causing trouble
title: The Independence Issue
subTitle: June 2024
author: Various
description: Super excited to share something newsprint with my daughter. This fun gift also has a lot of helpful advise that parents are not supposed to read.

coverAlt: Large geometric letters and a small pixel character falling down a screen
title: Ready Player Two
subTitle: A Novel
author: Ernest Cline
description: Accessible science fiction. Full of nostalgia for the 1980s. Don't listen to harsh reviews. This is a fun rewarding read like its predecessor.

coverAlt: Cover that mentions 4 million copies sold and #1 NYT bestselling author
title: Strengths Finder 2.0
author: Tom Rath
description: “You cannot be anything you want to be – but you can be a lot more of who you already are.” Are you the personality that enjoy’s personality tests? This one is a cool and positive perspective and great to complete as a team.

coverAlt: A bold book cover that lists the title and and illustration of a knight saying NYT Bestseller
title: Martyr
subTitle: A Novel
author: Kaveh Akbar
description: I am reading this book because it has a very good looking cover and it was included in the recent NY Times 100 Best Books of the 21st Century. Also, the book title has a bang!

coverAlt: A minimalist cover with the title 'James' and the author's name 'Percival Everett'
title: James
subTitle: A Novel
author: Percival Everett
description: A retelling of Huckleberry Finn. My partner, who just finished it for her book club, warned me that it's an intense read.

coverAlt: A collage illustration a vintage robot and creepy upsideown eyes
title: Just Enough Research
subTitle: Pulp trash special edition
author: Erika K. Hall
description: I've found an opportunity to read new editions of old favorites. This is probably the best book about UX research for practitioners and curious about design and product research.

coverAlt: The book title and other information aligned on a grid with the anatomy of the type labeled
title: Thinking with Type 3rd Edition
subTitle: A Critical Guide for Designers, Writers, Editors, & Students
author: Ellen Lupton

coverAlt: An illustration of a fish with a tag on the tail, apparently the book is a best seller
title: Why Fish Don't Exist
subTitle: A Story of Loss, Love, and the Hidden Order of Life
author: Lulu Miller

coverAlt: Cover of The Infinite Game by Simon Sinek with bold repeating text of the title
title: The Infinite Game
author: Simon Sinek
description: The joke is that I read the wrong book at book club. Turns out that this one is a good complement to his other novels. It also has my favorite diagram about performance and trust.

coverAlt: A lone astronaut floating in space with a bright light in the background
title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: Best experience is reading the book and then finding out that the movie is going to come out!

coverAlt: Cover of Leaders Eat Last by Simon Sinek with bold text and a circular design
title: Leaders Eat Last
subTitle: Why Some Teams Pull Together and Others Don’t
author: Simon Sinek
description: A book club selection at work. I find that it is great to read along side watching the videos.

coverAlt: A collage of abstract patterns the book title and text that reads national best sellter and forward by Janelle Monáe
title: Kindred
author: Octavia E. Butler
description: A great continuation of this year's reading themes of sci-fi and historical fiction.
